Omg! I love it, the more I wear it. -</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1432399"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1432399#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1422936" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1422936" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Josu01"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1019527"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1019527.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Josu01" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Scandal-Pour-Homme-Absolu-91053.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91053.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Scandal Pour Homme Absolu"title="Scandal Pour Homme Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1422936ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1422936" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1019527">Josu01</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-05">10/05/21 18:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Three notes.  Amazing, long lasting, very feminine perfume.<br />
<br />
I had a similar experience as others here.  First try of my sample from the official Penhaligons 'Portrait Perfume Library', I hated it.  Second try got me interested.  Third try (today) won me over.  I'm a male, and I liked how it developed on my skin. I kept smelling my  wrist all the time.  <br />
<br />
Beautiful florals with an added "je ne sais quoi".</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1422936"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1422936#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1419959" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1419959" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SmellsGood123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1256450"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SmellsGood123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pinrose/Pillowtalk-Poet-29565.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29565.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pillowtalk Poet"title="Pillowtalk Poet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1419959ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1419959" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1256450">SmellsGood123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-30">09/30/21 20:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is seriously one of my absolute favorite fragrances and I've only had it for 48 hours. This is completely unlike ANYTHING I own and it is breathtaking. It is so fresh and clean while simultaneously woody and dark. Complicated and ever changing it does not disappoint. When I sprayed it onto my wrist I first smelled greenery, fresh and damp; lovely. Then after maybe 10 minutes it had morphed into something dark and mysterious. Its woody and earthy notes drew me in closer and with every inhale my eyes would roll back. The warmth of every exhale brought this to life little by little until now, when compared to the opening, it is completely unrecognizable and undeniably seductive. Dangerously addictive and ever so entrancing. This is a gem and should definitely be experienced. If this is Lady Blanche's revenge then her love would be the death of me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1419959"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1419959#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1399539" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1399539" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ravenna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360311"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1360311.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ravenna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1399539ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1399539" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360311">ravenna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-27">08/27/21 04:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>"Flowery and green" doesn't do Lady Blanche justice. There's something narcotic but it never veers into medicinal. So so pretty, and bound to turn heads. A little too soapy for winter (also if you overspray), but I'd wear this year round.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1399539"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1399539#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1375098" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1375098" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Advaitaforever"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224809"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1224809.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Advaitaforever" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Houbigant/Essence-Rare-51691.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51691.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Essence Rare"title="Essence Rare"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1375098ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1375098" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224809">Advaitaforever</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-13">07/13/21 04:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very interesting fragrance. It opens with a sharp, bitter and biting green note reminiscent of the name and an obscure intention. As the fragrance dries down, the sweet, beautiful powdery and vulnerable floral notes emerge and conceal the bitter greenness, though it still remains throughout the duration. A very fresh, innocent and feminine scent character with a youthful and dewy texture that almost overshadows the thorny opening. Such a cool concept!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1375098"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1375098#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1366275" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1366275" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="penguinrabbit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="penguinrabbit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Fresh-Laundry-6763.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6763.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fresh Laundry"title="Fresh Laundry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1366275ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1366275" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583">penguinrabbit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-26">06/26/21 06:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like a literal bunch of flowers in a vase, very green. I like this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1366275"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1366275#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1349185" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1349185" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="redkettle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343348"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1343348.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="redkettle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1349185ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1349185" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343348">redkettle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-25">05/25/21 14:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This review is based on samples from the official Penhaligons 'Portrait Perfume Library'. <br />
<br />
I just reviewed Lord George q.v. I said he was cold, dated, and generic. Now I am reviewing Lady Blanche and my thoughts boil down to she is flowery, dated, and generic. Not much to add to dated and generic which are self-explanatory, what about the flowers?<br />
<br />
Very flowery. I just get a bouquet of flowers plonked in a vase, nothing else. This is perfume denying that it is a perfume. 'I am just a bunch of flowers', says Blanche. She pretends innocence, wide-eyed honesty, but she is lying. In denial. You are a perfume, Blanche, admit it! Blanche continues to scream her innocence/pretend to be a vase of flowers/denies she is a fragrance for about six hours or more with real no development in the dry down. A bit of a one-trick pony, our Blanche. It makes your headache listening to her shouting that she is not really there, it is just an invisible vase of flowers doing all the noise. Sure, Blanche, sure.<br />
<br />
I have smelt flowery Lady Blanche before - cannot be sure where but something like a 1970/80s bath soap from Yardley. Yardley marketed a fanasy 'ye olde Englande' in the 1970s/80s (they still do). And now Penhaligons are marketing a product designed to evoke nostalgia, not for the real 1970s/80s England of economic crisis, punk rock, miners strikes, and riots, but for 1970s/80s Yardley and its nostalgia for an imagined even older past as embodied in gift-wrapped soap, soap opera set in the past, and the entire English heritage tourism industry. 'I am just a bunch of flowers', says Blanche while cynically and dangerously evoking nostalgia for an 'England' that never existed, teaching a fake history, and  promoting 'alternative facts'. Does Blanche goose-step to her vase? Exactly what kind of vengeance, and against whom, does she have in mind? <br />
<br />
According to the marketing blurb, Lord George is supposed to be a tragic figure, Blanche a dangerous woman seeking revenge. I do not see George as Agamemnon nor Blanche as Clytemnestra. If Penhaligons had sold the Lord George perfume as Blanche's revenge (a dish served ice cold) and this flowery bouquet as George's secret tragedy it would be much more apt and far more intriguing. As it is, they made the obvious unimaginative choice and are thus promoting something not just boring but politically suspect. What's that you say? A bunch of flowers, or a perfume pretending to be a bunch of flowers, or a perfume pretending to be a 1970s soap pretending to be a Victorian bunch of flowers, is not political and has no relationship to a dangerous nostalgic-nationalism? Blanche is innocent!, you protest. Are you sure about that? And, yup, perfume can be political and so can a vase of flowers. <br />
<br />
Verdict: worth trying a sample. Not worth buying a full bottle when Yardley will take you to the same place for a few quid. And I am starting to look askance at Penhaligons and wonder about their political values. Everything they market about 'Blighty' is dangerous rubbish even if they pretend it is a joke. 'Irony' is no defence in my view. I am starting to think I should avoid buying their stuff whatever it smells like just to defund the toxic nonsense they pedal. Sigh. I wish some bright kid from Bradford or Middlesborough or somewhere would start an English perfume business selling eau de 'council estate' or 'zero hours contract' and replace this cloying fakery with something real, original, interesting, and smelling good! Why do we think 'ye olde manor house library perfume' would smell good but the 'local comprehensive school library perfume' would not? There truly is propaganda through perfume. Time it was challenged.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1349185"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1349185#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1348924" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1348924" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vanian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132632"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.132632.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vanian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1348924ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1348924" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132632">Vanian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-25">05/25/21 04:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>More violets on me than greens here. I see lot of people compare it to No19, well yes and no. As a long time wearer of No19 (well at least in the past), I'd say The Revenge of Lady Blanche is taking different route, more violet/iris combo on my skin. It is an addictive scent, I would definitely like to add it to my collection at some point, and I do agree something in it reminds me about a very well forgotten scent from the past (like 20-25 years ago) hm, which one though? <br />
p.s. By the way I think that the description in Penhaligon's site for 'ferocious matriarch' suits better Lady Blanche than The Duchess Dorothea,  but that's entirely my opinion of course, I got Dorothea recently, now I need to save for Blanche, both gorgeous fragrances!<br />
P.s. 12th June 21, I just remembered this is like original 80s Revlon's Charlie in the blue box (that is what reminds me of). Not that sure anymore I would spend now the $$$ for a bottle though, but I do really love it, anyway.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1348924"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1348924#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1334661" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1334661" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lomama"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317879"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1317879.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lomama" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1825.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco Vanille"title="Tobacco Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1334661ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1334661" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317879">Lomama</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-29">04/29/21 18:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Addictive smelling. I really like the scent, but it needed something more for me to want to buy a bottle. It was well done, but very ladylike, daytime, pearls, ribbons. Blanche's revenge isn't very poisonous, as I'd expect revenge to be. Served cold, right? This is served in a bed of flowers, pulverized and blended with Penhaligon's blending perfection, but flowers, nonetheless. Don't get me wrong, it's a gorgeous scent, but unlike many others from this house, it lacked polarizing note, for a layer of depth that I needed to be persuaded to buy a bottle. Blanche, get some b*tch lessons!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1334661"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1334661#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1291454" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1291454" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emerson10"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1238550"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="emerson10" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/ALTAIA/Don-t-Cry-For-Me-32343.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32343.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Don't Cry For Me"title="Don't Cry For Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1291454ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1291454" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1238550">emerson10</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-12">02/12/21 10:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>~WHEN THEY GO LOW, WE GO [TO] HIGH [TEA].~<br />
<br />
To me, Lady Blanche is a mischievous aristocrat; poised and ladylike, can be cutting with but a smile on her face.<br />
<br />
This opens quite powdery, the orris really shining here, in a powdery way akin to baby oil (but of high quality), then dries down in a beautiful way. I find orris generally to feel warmer than iris, but this skews more cold like I'm more used to with iris. I'm not particularly into powdery scents, but this is one I do love. Pleasant throughout, and then the green really comes through in the dry down. Like a powdery bouquet of flowers.<br />
<br />
Very elegant. Very refined. Very high tea vibes.<br />
<br />
update: I found myself reaching for this today, and 2nd around, I found it much more approachable. It's such a lovely green floral. It felt less powdery and more green second time around. Fresh and green.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1291454"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1291454#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1253103" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1253103" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jabouba"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165423"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165423.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jabouba" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Arabesque/Layla-33677.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33677.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Layla"title="Layla"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1253103ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1253103" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165423">Jabouba</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-25">11/25/20 17:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It’s a beautiful one omg, blew me away. <br />
Definitely it’s very similar to Chanel 19 but not exactly the same. I would say about 85% similar. <br />
If you love one of them the other one is yours</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1253103"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1253103#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1242404" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1242404" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="youngheart"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249782"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1249782.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="youngheart" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bottega-Veneta/Bottega-Veneta-12863.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12863.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bottega Veneta"title="Bottega Veneta"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1242404ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1242404" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249782">youngheart</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-28">10/28/20 15:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very green, potent and feminine. Sharp but playful in an almost deceiving way. Lady Blanche has many faces, she is posh and well put together, but she can also be ruthless and heartless. I think the backstory Penhaligon’s have created for this perfume matches it very well. I think it works in every season, but it shines in Summer evenings and nights. This is a “you need to take me seriously” scent, but it conveys a certain vulnerability at the same time. Perfect for fancy date nights.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1242404"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1242404#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1205104" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1205104" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elparf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247715"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1247715.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="elparf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mona-di-Orio/Vanille-12958.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12958.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille"title="Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1205104ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1205104" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247715">elparf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-07-29">07/29/20 08:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favorites! Starts very interesting, reminds me of fresh paint)) Then it opens with yellow flowers and I begin hear the bouquet of hyacinth, iris, narcissus and that paint note. <br />
I love it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1205104"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1205104#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1167559" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1167559" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Michelle12345678"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1014935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1014935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Michelle12345678" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Gold-70015.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70015.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold +"title="Gold +"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1167559ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1167559" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); Yellow florals. Purple florals. Makeup. Slightly green. This does not remind me of Chanel No. 19.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="40715"comment_id="1167559"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Revenge-Of-Lady-Blanche-40715.html?ccid=1167559#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1095300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
